title: Supervision Skills - Managing Employee Performance
headline: Make motivating and managing employee performance in the workplace easy, with this free online course.
description: This free online Supervision Skills course will teach you about the effective management of employee performance. Just like batteries, employees can lose energy over time. This course will guide you through the theory of motivation, and teach you the best ways to keep employees motivated and enjoying their work. It will also teach you how to spot and stop a workplace bullies. Start this free online course today to grow your management abilities.
courseDescription:
This course will first introduce you to the different theories of motivation such as Maslow's hierarchy of needs which include food, safety, love, and self-esteem, as well as the ERG theory which includes existence, relatedness, and growth. You will also cover processed-based theories, reinforcement theory, and goal setting theory. You will learn how and when to provide supervision for both staffs and volunteers as well as how to help staff to grow.

Next, you will learn about conducting performance reviews and how to use performance appraisals in a motivational way. You will study the 70:20:10 rule and learn how to correct performance problems. You will look into performance management, study the benefits of coaching, and learn the five different types of problem solutions. You will also learn how to deal with conflict within a work team, how to manage bullying, and the importance of the Ladder of Inference.

A workplace is composed of employees of different personalities and cultural backgrounds.This makes management and supervision a test of skill and patience. This employee performance management course will teach you practical supervision skills as well as goal setting and motivational theories that will be useful for your supervision and management duties. This will not only help you promote a healthy work environment, but also help your team to grow and be happy and productive in their work. So why wait? Boost your supervision skills, today.
